title: The Complication: A Documentary of Erasure
tagline: A daughter's search for a forgotten radical cracks the museum of her mother's perfect revolution.
themes: Daughters as Curators of Maternal Legacy
The Violence of a Sanitized History

chapters.title: The Cost of Being a Complication
The Torch, Not the Battering Ram
A New Corner of the Corkboard
Take Your Foot Off Our Necks

story: Write a scene where a character discovers a 'complication' in their family's or community's official history. How do they investigate it, and what personal cost do they face?
Create a found document (letter, journal entry, protest flyer, police report) that reveals a hidden conflict between two characters in a social movement.
Write a dialogue between a 'second-wave' feminist and a 'fourth-wave' feminist where they try to find common ground, but keep talking past each other because of their unspoken generational trauma.
Imagine a character curating a 'Wall of Worthies' for a cause they believe in. Who do they include, and more importantly, who do they consciously or unconsciously leave out? Why?
technical: Build a simple web-based 'Documentary Archive' where users can click on items on a virtual corkboard (like Joan's) to reveal hidden documents, audio clips, or conflicting testimonies about a single historical event.
Create a text-analysis script that compares the language of feminist manifestos from different decades, visualizing the shift in keywords, tone, and demanded actions.

council: Rebecca Solnit (historian of silence and erasure)
Margo Jefferson (explorer of curated family legacies)
Mona Eltahawy (writer on intergenerational feminist conflict)

cover_prompt: A young woman's hands carefully peel back a layer of pristine white paint from a museum wall, revealing a vibrant, defiant protest mural beneath, [Detailed Scene & Context: set in a cold, minimalist archival room with glass cases containing orderly displays of suffragette sashes and polished buttons, contrasting with the raw, uncovered graffiti of fists, raised voices, and erased faces], [Artistic Style & Medium: in the atmospheric style of Charlotte Salomon meets Kara Walker, using mixed media of textured acrylics and archival photo transfer on canvas, creating a palimpsest of history], [Composition & Camera: book cover framing, an extreme close-up centered on the point of revelation where the daughter's fingers meet the mother's hidden past, shot from a low angle to emphasize the weight of discovery], [Lighting & Color Palette: dramatic chiaroscuro lighting with a single stark light source, color palette of institutional whites and greys violently interrupted by the uncovered umbers, oxblood reds, and faded yellows of the radical past], masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev.
